message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a geometric graph problem of finding the minimum spanning tree of a rooted point set, which is a classic problem in computational geometry (cs.CG). The algorithmic aspect of the paper involves designing a linear time algorithm, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the degree of the rooted $y-$MMST, which is a combinatorial property of the graph, and hence, it can be categorized under discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also involves drawing rooted trees as rooted $y-$MMSTs, which is a graph drawing problem (cs.GR). Finally, the paper discusses the area requirement for drawing certain rooted trees, which is a computational complexity issue (cs.SI).
